ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.

ElementDescription: Sex of subject at birth
Notes: M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported

ElementDescription: Risk Behaviors Scale - Total
Notes: Sum of c_arq_beh_1 through c_arq_beh_22

ElementDescription: Risk Behaviors Scale - Mean
Notes: Mean of c_arq_beh_1 through c_arq_beh_22

ElementDescription: Thrill-Seeking Behavior Subscale - Total
Notes: c_arq_beh_1 + c_arq_beh_2 + c_arq_beh_3 + c_arq_beh_4 + c_arq_beh_5 + c_arq_beh_6 + c_arq_beh_7

ElementDescription: Thrill-Seeking Behavior Subscale - Mean
Notes: Mean of c_arq_beh_1, c_arq_beh_2, c_arq_beh_3, c_arq_beh_4, c_arq_beh_5, c_arq_beh_6, c_arq_beh_8

ElementDescription: Rebellious Behavior Subscale - Total
Notes: c_arq_beh_8 + c_arq_beh_9 + c_arq_beh_10 + c_arq_beh_11 + c_arq_beh_12

ElementDescription: Rebellious Behavior Subscale - Mean
Notes: Mean of c_arq_beh_8, c_arq_beh_9, c_arq_beh_10, c_arq_beh_11, c_arq_beh_12

ElementDescription: Reckless Behavior Subscale - Total
Notes: c_arq_beh_13 + c_arq_beh_14 + c_arq_beh_15 + c_arq_beh_16 + c_arq_beh_17

ElementDescription: Reckless Behavior Subscale - Mean
Notes: Mean of c_arq_beh_13, c_arq_beh_14, c_arq_beh_15, c_arq_beh_16, c_arq_beh_17

ElementDescription: Antisocial Behavior Subscale - Total
Notes: c_arq_beh_18 + c_arq_beh_19 + c_arq_beh_20 + c_arq_beh_21 + c_arq_beh_22

ElementDescription: Antisocial Behavior Subscale - Mean
Notes: Mean of c_arq_beh_18, c_arq_beh_19, c_arq_beh_20, c_arq_beh_21, c_arq_beh_22

ElementDescription: Risk Judgements Scale - Total
Notes: Sum of c_arq_judg_1 through c_arq_judg_22

ElementDescription: Risk Judgements Scale  - Mean
Notes: Mean of c_arq_judg_1 through c_arq_judg_22

ElementDescription: Thrill-Seeking Judgment Subscale - Total
Notes: c_arq_judg_1 + c_arq_judg_2 + c_arq_judg_3 + c_arq_judg_4 + c_arq_judg_5 + c_arq_judg_6 + c_arq_judg_7

ElementDescription: Thrill-Seeking Judgment Subscale - Mean
Notes: Mean of c_arq_judg_1, c_arq_judg_2, c_arq_judg_3, c_arq_judg_4, c_arq_judg_5, c_arq_judg_6, c_arq_judg_8

ElementDescription: Rebellious Judgment Subscale - Total
Notes: c_arq_judg_8 + c_arq_judg_9 + c_arq_judg_10 + c_arq_judg_11 + c_arq_judg_12

ElementDescription: Rebellious Judgment Subscale - Mean
Notes: Mean of c_arq_judg_8, c_arq_judg_9, c_arq_judg_10, c_arq_judg_11, c_arq_judg_12

ElementDescription: Reckless Judgment Subscale - Total
Notes: c_arq_judg_13 + c_arq_judg_14 + c_arq_judg_15 + c_arq_judg_16 + c_arq_judg_17

ElementDescription: Reckless Judgment Subscale - Mean
Notes: Mean of c_arq_judg_13, c_arq_judg_14, c_arq_judg_15, c_arq_judg_16, c_arq_judg_17

ElementDescription: Antisocial Judgment Subscale - Total
Notes: c_arq_judg_18 + c_arq_judg_19 + c_arq_judg_20 + c_arq_judg_21 + c_arq_judg_22

ElementDescription: Antisocial Judgment Subscale - Mean
Notes: Mean of c_arq_judg_18, c_arq_judg_19, c_arq_judg_20, c_arq_judg_21, c_arq_judg_22

ElementDescription: I have done something risky or dangerous on a dare.
Notes: 0= Never, 1= Once or twice, 2= Several times, 3= Many times

ElementDescription: I have broken a rule that my parents set just for the thrill of seeing if I could get away with it.
Notes: 0= Never, 1= Once or twice, 2= Several times, 3= Many times

ElementDescription: I have stolen or shoplifted.
Notes: 0= Never, 1= Once or twice, 2= Several times, 3= Many times

ElementDescription: I have snuck out of my house without my parents knowing.
Notes: 0= Never, 1= Once or twice, 2= Several times, 3= Many times

ElementDescription: I have willingly ridden in a car with someone I knew was a dangerous driver.
Notes: 0= Never, 1= Once or twice, 2= Several times, 3= Many times

ElementDescription: I have had sex with someone I just met.
Notes: 0= Never, 1= Once or twice, 2= Several times, 3= Many times

ElementDescription: I have dated or hooked up with someone else's boyfriend or girlfriend.
Notes: 0= Never, 1= Once or twice, 2= Several times, 3= Many times

ElementDescription: I have raced a car or motorcycle.
Notes: 0= Never, 1= Once or twice, 2= Several times, 3= Many times

ElementDescription: I have cheated on an exam or homework.
Notes: 0= Never, 1= Once or twice, 2= Several times, 3= Many times

ElementDescription: I have cheated on a boyfriend or girlfriend.
Notes: 0= Never, 1= Once or twice, 2= Several times, 3= Many times

ElementDescription: I have gotten drunk or high at a party.
Notes: 0= Never, 1= Once or twice, 2= Several times, 3= Many times

ElementDescription: I have ridden in a car without wearing a seat belt.
Notes: 0= Never, 1= Once or twice, 2= Several times, 3= Many times

ElementDescription: I have tagged or defaced public property.
Notes: 0= Never, 1= Once or twice, 2= Several times, 3= Many times

ElementDescription: I have had sex without using protection.
Notes: 0= Never, 1= Once or twice, 2= Several times, 3= Many times

ElementDescription: I have looked at my phone while driving a car (e.g., texting, looking at notifications).
Notes: 0= Never, 1= Once or twice, 2= Several times, 3= Many times

ElementDescription: I have sent sexy messages or pictures to someone.
Notes: 0= Never, 1= Once or twice, 2= Several times, 3= Many times

ElementDescription: I have skipped class even though I knew I could get in trouble and fall behind in my schoolwork.
Notes: 0= Never, 1= Once or twice, 2= Several times, 3= Many times

ElementDescription: Adolescent Risk Taking Scale score (first 14 questions)
Adolescent Risk Taking Scale score (all 17 questions)
Timepoint/visit label
Notes: e.g., Baseline, Morning, At Bedtime

ElementDescription: Timepoint Wave data collected
Notes: 1 = Wave 1; 2 = Wave 2; 3 = Wave 3

ElementDescription: Miscellaneous comments on study, interview, methodology relevant to this form data
